item.title: Pokemon GO Reveals Eggs-pedition Access Details for June
item.description:
Summary

  • Pokemon GO's June 2025 Eggs-pedition Access features $4.99 tickets, Incubator rewards, 3x XP, and special tasks.
  • Fans can buy the Eggs-pedition Access Ultra Ticket Box for $14.99 on June 10, offering tickets for June, July, and August.
  • Pokemon GO has exciting activities lined up for June, including Legendary Raids and the Delightful Days season.

Pokemon GO has revealed a new edition of Eggs-pedition Access scheduled for June 3, 2025. Pokemon GO recently unveiled its next season, which is set to debut multiple Pokemon and feature exciting events for players.

June is going to be a busy month for Pokemon GO fans, as the game has a ton of events planned for the upcoming weeks. Pokemon GO 's Delightful Days season is kicking off on June 3 and will have a summer-themed feel. The developers have teased some exciting debuts for the season, including Hisuian Lilligant, Yamper, and Tatsugiri. Pokemon GO also revealed the return of the fan-favorite Eggs-pedition Access bonus, and the game recently announced the rewards that players can expect with their ticket.

Pokemon GO has confirmed that the June 2025 Eggs-pedition Access ticket will cost $4.99 through the in-game store. The ticket can be purchased starting on June 3 and will remain activated until July 3 at 10:00 AM local time. With Eggs-pedition Access in effect, players will receive a single-use Incubator per day from their first PokeStop or Gym spin. Other bonuses include thrice the XP for the first catch and PokeStop or Gym spin of the day. Additionally, ticket-holders can open up to 50 Pokemon GO gifts from friends daily, which can be useful to augment Friendship levels. Finally, players can also access special Timed Research tasks that reward 15,000 XP and Stardust.

Pokemon GO June 2025 Eggs-pedition Access Details

  • From Tuesday, June 3, 2025, at 10:00 a.m. to Thursday, July 3, 2025, at 10:00 a.m. local time.
  • Price: $4.99
  • Bonuses:
    • One single-use Incubator awarded for your first PokeStop or Gym spin of the day.
    • 3× XP awarded for your first catch of the day.
    • 3× XP awarded for your first PokeStop or Gym spin of the day.
    • Open up to 50 Gifts per day.
    • Receive up to 150 Gifts per day from spinning PokeStop and Gym Photo Discs.
    • Hold up to 40 Gifts in your Item Bag.

  • Eggs-pedition Access: June Timed Research Rewards
    • 15,000 XP
    • 15,000 Stardust

  • Eggs-pedition Access Ultra Ticket Box
    • Price: $14.99
    • Includes Eggs-pedition Access: June, July, and August tickets
    • 100 bonus PokeCoins
    • Available via the Pokemon GO Web Store on June 10, 2025, at 5:00 p.m. PDT

Fans can also buy the Eggs-pedition Access Ultra Ticket Box from the Pokemon GO Web Store for $14.99 on June 10 at 5:00 PM PDT. This offer grants players Eggs-pedition tickets for June, July, and August, plus 100 PokeCoins. Pokemon GO previously confirmed that some rare Pokemon like Bagon, Charcadet, Frigibax, and Jangmo-o will be coming out of 10 km eggs in the following months, so the Eggs-pedition ticket could help players make the most out of their hatching. On the other hand, fans should be on the lookout for Pokemon GO 's June Community Day, as Jangmo-o will be the protagonist.

Pokemon GO has already revealed plenty of activities planned for June, including several Legendary Raids. For example, from June 23 to 27, Pokemon GO 's Ancients Recovered event is bringing back all five Regi Giants. Kiogre and Groudon are making a comeback as well, starting on June 5. The Delightful Days season will also coincide with the game's ninth anniversary in July, which will likely feature an event with party-hat Pokemon.

item.title: Kamisato Ayato Team Composition Guide In Genshin Impact
item.description:
Ayato

Hydro

Sword

Inazuma

Guides

Ascension

Builds

Weapons

Team Comp

Constellation

Player Mistakes

Back to All Characters

Similar to Childe in Genshin Impact , Kamisato Ayato relies on his Hydro infusion to deal DMG. This infusion is obtained for a few seconds through his Elemental Skill. Meanwhile, his Elemental Burst is somewhat similar to Ganyu, where he causes Hydro rain on the battlefield. In a team, Kamisato Ayato appears to work best either as a main DPS or as a Hydro enabler.

Updated May 29, 2025, by Nahda Nabiilah: Escoffier has changed the game for Cryo-needing teams. Now, Morgana teams have a very strong debuffer who shreds enemies’ resistance by a whopping 55%. Of course, with an ability like that, all the Hydro and Cryo characters are making a comeback. There aren’t many units in Genshin Impact that are excellent at constantly applying Hydro in an AoE. Whether players are seeking to use Ayato as a main DPS or go stray and use him as a Hydro enabler, it’s crucial to know the best team comp for Ayato in Genshin Impact .

5 Ayato + Furina + Citlali + Escoffier

Playing Ayato in a Freeze team is far better than it used to be before Natlan, thanks to Citlali and Escoffier. Citlali can reduce enemies’ resistance by 20% while increasing Ayato’s DMG by 40% with her Scroll of the Hero of Cinder City set. On the other hand, Escoffier heavily shreds enemies’ resistance by 55%, which will insanely buff Ayato’s Hydro DMG. Finally, Furina will take Ayato’s DMG to the next level with her Elemental Burst’s buff.

Team Roles

  • Ayato: Main DPS, Hydro Enabler
  • Furina: Sub-DPS, Healer, Buffer, Hydro Enabler
  • Citlali: Shielder, Buffer, Debuffer, Cryo Enabler
  • Escoffier: Sub-DPS, Debuffer, Cryo Enabler

4 Ayato + Nahida + Nilou + Baizhu

Since Ayato has a strong Hydro-enabling ability, players can include him in a Bloom team in Genshin Impact . When he finishes his Elemental Skill, players can count on Ayato’s Elemental Burst and Nilou’s Hydro-enabling ability to keep the Hydro application going. From the Dendro units' side, Nahida and Baizhu barely need any field time to keep the field flooding with off-field Dendro attacks.

Team Roles

  • Ayato: Main DPS, Hydro Enabler, Driver
  • Nahida: Sub-DPS, Buffer, Debuffer, Dendro Enabler
  • Nilou: Buffer, Hydro Enabler
  • Baizhu: Healer, Buffer, Debuffer, Dendro Enabler

3 Ayato + Nahida + Kuki Shinobu + Baizhu

Aside from Bloom teams, Ayato can also work with other Dendro reactions in Genshin Impact . Replacing Nilou with Kuki Shinobu boosts Nahida’s DMG by introducing the Spread reaction to her DPS.

Additionally, Ayato will create Bloom cores that remain on the field, waiting for Kuki’s Electro to transform them into Hyperbloom missiles. It’s a strong team with enough synergy to continuously create and trigger Hyperbloom DMG in Genshin Impact .

Team Roles

  • Ayato: Main DPS, Hydro Enabler, Driver
  • Nahida: Sub-DPS, Buffer, Debuffer, Dendro Enabler
  • Kuki Shinobu: Healer, Electro Enabler, Hyperbloom Trigger
  • Baizhu: Healer, Buffer, Debuffer, Dendro Enabler

2 Ayato + Fischl + Ororon + Ifa

For F2P Ayato teams, you can pair Ayato with Electro characters to trigger as many Electro-charged reactions as possible. Although Ayato is mostly a main DPS, he has a strong Hydro application when he leaves the field, helping both Fischl and Ororon to trigger more Electro-charged reactions. On top of that, when Fischl gets her C6 passive ability, she will be able to send an Electro attack with every Ayato Normal attack, creating an endless stream of Electro-charged reactions. This Electro-charged atmosphere will allow Ororon to enter his Nightsoul's Blessing state and buff Ayato’s DMG by 40%.

When Ayato’s Elemental Skill is on cooldown and his Elemental Burst is up, players can switch to Ifa to roam around enemies, shooting them with Anemo attacks and reducing their resistance to further increase the effectiveness of every Electro-charged reaction. Players can replace Ifa with many other Anemo units, especially Sucrose, who can greatly buff the team’s Elemental Mastery.

Team Roles

  • Ayato: Main DPS, Hydro Enabler
  • Fischl: Sub-DPS, Electro Enabler
  • Ororon: Sub-DPS, Buffer, Battery, Electro Enabler
  • Ifa: Healer, Buffer, Debuffer, Swirl Trigger

1 Ayato + Kazuha + Xiangling + Bennett

This team adopts the mainstream idea of the national team. Usually, the Hydro unit in this team composition is Xingqiu, but here, Kamisato Ayato takes the lead. The idea behind having the Pyro characters is to trigger Vaporize reactions with Ayato and Xiangling. Meanwhile, Kazuha and Bennett will allow both characters to deal massive DMG.

No matter how strong Xiangling’s Energy Recharge stat is, she always needs Bennett to regain her Elemental Burst. And it’s not bad, since Xiangling snapshots Bennett’s buff, which means her Pyronado will spin around the entire duration buffed by Kazuha and Bennett’s buffs. Not to mention, both Pyro characters will trigger the Pyro Resonance, adding 25% extra ATK to the team.

Team Roles

  • Ayato: Main DPS, Hydro Enabler
  • Kazuha: Crowd Control, Buffer, Debuffer
  • Xiangling: Sub-DPS, Pyro Enabler
  • Bennett: Support, Healer, Buffer, Battery

6 Images
6 Images

item.title: Kokomi Build Guide In Genshin Impact
item.description:
Kokomi

Hydro

Catalyst

Inazuma

Guides

Ascension

Builds

Weapons

Team Comp

Constellation

Player Mistakes

Back to All Characters

Kokomi had a rough debut in Genshin Impact as she was overshadowed by the Electro Archon. Nevertheless, she manages to slip her way into the meta with her many qualities that allow her to shine in many teams.

Kokomi can work as a main DPS, enabler, full-time healer, or even a buffer (with specific builds). For players who are wondering how they should build the Watatsumi Priestess, here's a guide on Kokomi build in Genshin Impact .

Updated May 29, 2025, by Nahda Nabiilah: Kokomi has gone a long way since her release. With the Dendro reactions release and many years' worth of new content, Kokomi still has excellent healing alongside a respectable DMG output. She can still handle both the role of a healer and a DPS at the same time, and that's what players should target when building her.

Kokomi Build In Genshin Impact

Weapon

Artifact Set

Stats

  1. Everlasting Moonglow
  2. Ring of Yaxche
  3. Prototype Amber
  4. Ash-Graven Drinking Horn
  5. Thrilling Tales of Dragon Slayers
  6. Hakushin Ring
  7. Sacrificial Fragments

  • Ocean-Hued Clam (Healing DPS)
  • Tenacity of the Millelith (Buffer)
  • Flower of Paradise Lost (Bloom Trigger)
  • Heart of Depth (Hydro DPS)
  • Maiden Beloved (Dedicated Healer)

  • Timepiece: HP or Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: HP or Hydro DMG
  • Circlet: HP or Healing Bonus
  • Sub-stat: HP and Energy Recharge

Kokomi Best Artifact In Genshin Impact

Building Kokomi’s artifact sets in Genshin Impact heavily relies on her role. The best artifacts for Kokomi are Ocean-Hued Clam , as the set allows her to deal large Hydro and Physical DMG while healing at the same time. Players can go for Heart of Depth , which only enhances Kokomi’s Hydro DMG, but is still acceptable if players don’t have an Ocean-Hued Clam set. Although the Ocean-Hued Clam set will not directly enhance Kokomi’s DMG, like Heart of Depths, it will accumulate Kokomi's healing over three seconds and deal great Physical DMG afterward. Every time the set deals DMG, players can expect more than 25k DMG in a small AoE. But note that the AoE of this equipment is quite small, so Kokomi should be positioned accordingly.

For other options, the Tenacity of the Millelith set is a good source of DMG buff, especially if players can continuously refresh Kokomi’s Elemental Skill. Hitting a target with an Elemental Skill will increase the ATK of nearby party members by 20% for three seconds. The extra max HP will make Kokomi's Elemental Skill and Burst more powerful, while the ATK buff will increase the effectiveness of the entire party.

When playing in a Bloom team in Genshin Impact , players can build Kokomi with the Flower of Paradise Lost set. It’s specifically made for Dendro Core reactions and would greatly enhance them when Kokomi triggers them.

Finally, as a last resort, players can build Kokomi as a dedicated healer with the Maiden Beloved set, but it’s not recommended, as Kokomi can do much more than just healing.

Kokomi Best Weapon In Genshin Impact

The best weapon for Kokomi in Genshin Impact is Everlasting Moonglow . The weapon grants HP sub-stats, which greatly benefit Kokomi, as her DMG scales with HP. Meanwhile, the passive effect increases Kokomi’s Healing Bonus while increasing her Normal DMG and restoring Energy when she hits a target. This allows the Priestess to have her Elemental Burst constantly, so she can dominate the field with her presence.

Considering that some players may not get Everlasting Moonglow for Kokomi, they can opt for Prototype Amber as a F2P alternative. This 4-star F2P Catalyst provides everything Kokomi needs, including HP, minor Healing, and Energy restoration. Ring of Yaxche is also one of the best Catalysts for Kokomi in Genshin Impact , as it buffs her Normal attack DMG directly by scaling it with her Max HP. A more straight-to-the-point weapon that helps her shine as a DPS.

Thrilling Tales of Dragon Slayers is a 3-Star option for Kokomi. It can be acquired very easily and also grants HP as its second stat. The weapon’s passive grants characters switching in a big ATK% buff. This is useful for Kokomi to operate as a buffer when she’s using the Tenacity of the Millelith set.

Alternatively, if players want a more team-wide buffing Catalyst for Kokomi, then go for Hakushin Ring . As long as Kokomi triggers electro-charged, she will constantly grant Electro and Hydro DMG buffs to the whole party.

Kokomi Talent Priority In Genshin Impact

Kokomi’s talent priority in Genshin Impact would be Elemental Burst > Elemental Skill > Normal Attack . However, if Kokomi is only a healer support, then Burst and Normal Attack can be ignored.

Kokomi Talent Level Recommendation:

  • Normal Attack : 10
  • Elemental Skill : 10
  • Elemental Burst : 10

item.title: Is Pokemon Unite Worth Playing in 2025?
item.description:
Pokémon Unite has maintained its momentum since launch, to the point that it has been four years since its initial release, and the game is still actively growing. Regular additions of new Pokemons and consistent balancing patches have kept the game fresh and challenging, unlike most Pokémon games that become highly niche after seeing initial peaks. The game stands strong mainly for its iterative depth within the saturated field of MOBAs. Plus, its competitive integrity remains intact, too, since the updates have always meaningfully evolved the meta.

The game’s mechanics remain easy to learn but hard to master, which is a reason the game still remains relevant, as Pokemon Unite rewards players who understand positioning, objective control, and team coordination. Another reason the game has stood the test of time in this competitive landscape is its familiar format — team-based online matches that give Pokémon fans a strategic multiplayer experience, akin to competitive standards in games like League of Legends or Overwatch. For those wondering if Pokemon Unite is worth a look in 2025, the answer is undoubtedly yes.

A Growing Roster and Constant Challenges

Pokemon Unite ’s strength lies in its evolving roster. The release of new Pokemons, in particular, has helped to introduce new mechanics and balance changes that make players rethink their strategies. For instance, Miraidon’s ranged burst immediately changed priority picks when it came out, and Umbreon’s defensive disruption forced a rethink of zoning strategies. Moving forward, there’s Alcremie lined up for a release in June 2025, as well, so the studio is clearly still rolling out updates. And whether it’s a high-speed attacker or a defensive tank, every Pokémon addition has meaningfully elevated gameplay.

Players who want to stay competitive must adjust not only their preferred Pokemon choices every now and then, but also their broader strategies. These frequent shifts prevent the game from becoming predictable and give players reasons to keep playing and learning. While the frequency of releases has definitely slowed compared to 2023, staying static in Pokemon Unite still means falling behind, as even minor additions can shift team fight dynamics, lane control strategies, and objective timing.

Competitive Play Remains Strong and Accessible

The competitive scene in Pokemon Unite has remained robust since the very beginning. Firstly, because of how layered the game is, there are regular regional tournaments organized by the player base. Secondly, the game’s inclusion in the Pokemon World Championships in 2022, and its continued presence ever since has further elevated community engagement.

Plus, unlike many other MOBAs, Unite offers shorter match times and a streamlined skill system, making it easy for new players to jump in for a quick thrill while still delivering the exact complexity and dynamic depth that keep experienced players engaged as well. The game’s ranking system and events also add to the competitive scene and give players clear paths to improve.

It’s Clear That Technical Improvements Make a Difference

Pokemon Unite has also made noticeable progress in quality-of-life updates, improving matchmaking speed, communication tools, and server performance over the years, which has led to a good word-of-mouth among the community. These improvements have removed unnecessary frustration, allowed players to focus on gameplay, and given the franchise’s fans a reason to have trust in TiMi Studios.

Plus, the game’s progression system is also streamlined now, with Pokemon Unite 's monetization models like battle passes and cosmetics separated from core gameplay mechanics. Competitive players aren’t forced into pay-to-win scenarios, and skill and understanding of the game remain the primary drivers of success. In 2025, the decision to play Pokemon Unite comes down to whether a player has a knack for the franchise and wants to pair that skill with strategic gameplay that’s backed by a studio that clearly cares.

item.title: How To Restore HP In Elden Ring Nightreign
item.description:
Elden Ring Nightreign requires players to quickly run from boss to boss to earn runes and strengthen their characters before the next Nightboss. Unless you're a perfect dodger, some of these bosses will deal decent damage to you, and you're health will go down quickly.

There are a few ways for players to restore health, and picking the right ones for your party and character is crucial to make it through your expedition. Here are all the ways to restore your own and your teammates' health in Elden Ring Nightreign .

How To Heal In Elden Ring Nightreign

There are a few ways to restore HP, with some of them acting a little differently than they did in Elden Ring :

  • Use the Flask Of Crimson Tears.
  • Approach a Site of Grace.
  • Use a Warming Rock.
  • Interact with HP restoration bushes.

Your Flask will upgrade as you level up, healing more based on your total health. You can also add more charges to your Flask, up to a total of seven in an expedition. You can restore the charges in your flask and heal simply by walking near a Site of Grace , with you only needing to interact with it to level up. You'll also occasionally get random charges for your flask as time progresses, though it is often random and unreliable.

HP restoration bushes have an orange glow to the berries , and interacting with the blank will cost a similarly-colored mist to appear around the bush for about twenty seconds. All allies within the mist will have their HP slowly restored.

Warming Stones are your go-to consumables to restore your own and your teammates' health, as they slowly restore the HP of everyone who stands close by. These can be found in just about any breakable container that holds loot, such as wooden boxes and any kind of chest. They are also potential drops from loot found on dead bodies throughout Limveld.

How To Increase Your Max HP In Elden Ring Nightreign

Leveling up gives points into Vigor for all characters, increasing your max health in different amounts based on which character you're playing as. While that is one way to increase your max HP, you can also find Talismen by hunting beetles that also increase your max HP . These Talismen can also be purchased at merchants, but both of these options are randomized.

For every character, there is also the chance of a Max HP boost dropping in a boss cache. These increase your max HP by a percentage , so some characters will benefit from this boost more than others. Aside from leveling up, further boosting your max HP is based completely on chance, so it's not an ideal upgrade to focus on, as you may end up missing out on other, better ways of strengthening your character.
